executive_summary.overview: MK-Ultra was an illegal CIA human experimentation program (1953-1973) designed to develop mind control procedures and interrogation drugs. Part of a larger cluster of behavioral control programs including Bluebird, Artichoke, MK-Naomi, and MK-Search.
executive_summary.concealment_method: Systematic record destruction ordered by CIA Director Richard Helms and program director Sidney Gottlieb in 1973
executive_summary.significance: Represents documented case of CIA destroying evidence of illegal human experimentation to prevent accountability
executive_summary.current_status: Partially exposed through 1975 Church Committee and surviving documents; full scope remains unknown due to destruction

bluebird.name: Project Bluebird
bluebird.focus: Investigative techniques including drugs and hypnosis

artichoke.name: Project Artichoke
artichoke.focus: Forced interrogation, involuntary assassination attempts, morphine addiction/withdrawal, LSD, amnesia induction

mk_ultra.name: Project MK-Ultra
mk_ultra.focus: Mind control drugs, LSD experimentation, psychological torture, brainwashing techniques
mk_ultra.scale: 150+ human experiments, unwitting and cognizant subjects

concealment_strategy.destruction_timing: Upon program termination and Gottlieb's departure
concealment_strategy.partial_failure: 20,000 pages survived at non-standard records center
concealment_strategy.disclosure_forced_by: 1975 Church Committee and Rockefeller Commission investigations
concealment_strategy.remaining_gaps: Full scope of experiments, complete victim list, all participating institutions

peripheral_evidence_available.surviving_documents: ~20,000 pages found 1977 by Admiral Stansfield Turner
peripheral_evidence_available.physical_evidence: LSD purchases ($240,000 for world supply), facility records

key_findings: MK-Ultra approved April 13, 1953 by CIA Director Allen Dulles in response to alleged Soviet/Chinese/North Korean mind control use on POWs
Sidney Gottlieb arranged CIA purchase of entire world LSD supply for $240,000
150+ human experiments involved psychedelic drugs, paralytics, electroshock therapy
Experiments conducted on unwitting and cognizant subjects
Program included psychiatric research to 'crush the human psyche to the point that it would admit anything'
Most records destroyed by Richard Helms and Sidney Gottlieb in 1973
Frank Olson death November 28, 1953 after being dosed with LSD by Gottlieb - ruled suicide but evidence suggests murder
Program exposed publicly in 1975 by Church Committee and Rockefeller Commission
Survived 20,000 pages discovered 1977 at non-standard records center
Program originated from Operation Paperclip Nazi scientist recruitment
research_methodology_notes: This analysis employs peripheral evidence attack strategy: when direct records are destroyed, reconstruct from financial records, institutional partnerships, victim documentation, and surviving fragments. Congressional appropriations, university IRB records, pharmaceutical shipment logs, and victim lawsuits provide angles of approach that cannot be destroyed by the primary perpetrators.
